actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.
Committee on Finance requested executive comment from OMB, Treasury Department, Health and Human Services Department.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to eliminate the three percent threshhold amount for cost-of-living adjustments.
short_title: Social Security Cost-of-Living Adjustment Act of 1984
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Social Security Cost-of-Living Adjustment Act of 1984 - Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to provide a cost-of-living increase in benefits without regard to whether a percentage threshold is met.

titles.title: Social Security Cost-of-Living Adjustment Act of 1984
A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to eliminate the three percent threshhold amount for cost-of-living adjustments.
